revision.text: {{WikiProject Video games|class=Start|importance=mid|screenshot=yes}} ==Soundtrack== Sober (Saint US mix) by [[Muse]] was featured in the game. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/83.253.170.147|83.253.170.147]] ([[User talk:83.253.170.147|talk]]) 11:33, 2 September 2008 (UTC) :Not in the U.S. version. I have the game, and it's nowhere on the soundtrack list. [[User:Stooben Rooben|Stooben Rooben]] ([[User talk:Stooben Rooben|talk]]) 21:33, 2 September 2008 (UTC) It's only in the european version of the game then I guess. My uncle has the game and it's in it. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/83.253.170.147|83.253.170.147]] ([[User talk:83.253.170.147|talk]]) 14:33, 4 September 2008 (UTC) ::List is very incomplete. The soundtrack consisted of: *Lenny Kravitz - Are You Gonna Go My Way? (Gran Turismo Remix) *Motley Crue - Kickstart My Heart *Jimi Hendrix - Stone Free *Grinspoon - Champion *The Cult - She Sells Sanctuary *8 Stops 7 - Satisfied *Goldfinger - 99 Red Balloons (Adapted from '99 Luftballons) *Papa Roach - Never Enough *Powerman 5000 - Supernova Goes Pop *Grand Theft Audio - As Good As It Gets *Methods of Mayhem - Crash *Judas Priest - Turbo Lover *Apollo 440 - Stop The Rock (Mint Royale Mix) *BT - Mad Skillz-Mic Chekka *CiRRUS - Break In *Elite Force - Call It Brisco (And Why Not?) *Junkie XL - Def Beat *Feeder - Just A Day *Ash - Shark *Death In Vegas - Aisha *Grand Theft Audio - Dead Man Leaving *Feeder - Buck Rogers *Feeder - 7 Days In The Sun *Muse - Sober (Saint US mix) *Grand Theft Audio - Avarice *Grand Theft Audio - Wake Up In Your Own Mind *Overseer - Screw Up (Edited version for GT3) *Overseer - Stompbox *Overseer - Supermoves *Daiki Kasho - Glowl *Daiki Kasho - Mirage *Daiki Kasho - Obscure *Daiki Kasho - Sky Scraper *Daiki Kasho - Strike Breaker *Lenny Kravitz - Again *Dave Aude - Go Gran Turismo *Raekwon - Determination *Snoop Dogg - Dogg's Turismo 3 [[Special:Contributions/86.168.87.83|86.168.87.83]] ([[User talk:86.168.87.83|talk]]) 00:58, 9 November 2008 (UTC) ==Expansion== This article is extremely short. Would it be alright if I expanded it? I have the game, so I believe I could make it quite impressive. [[User:Stooben Rooben|Stooben Rooben]] ([[User talk:Stooben Rooben|talk]]) 00:05, 27 August 2008 (UTC) == Different Covers? == Didn't the European version have a red cover? Also, with the soundtrack there was Buck Rogers, Just a Day and 7 days in the sun by feeder as well... —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/89.240.194.156|89.240.194.156]] ([[User talk:89.240.194.156|talk]]) 14:44, 29 December 2008 (UTC) :The Japanese version had a red cover, and this was brought to the US when the game was bundled with the PS2. The US red cover also has a "Not for sale" tag due to it being bundled, but apparently Sony needs to brush up on [[First Sale Doctrine]]. The existence of this version also seems to void the claim in the article about GT3 being one of the best-selling UNbundled games. [[Special:Contributions/76.254.15.190|76.254.15.190]] ([[User talk:76.254.15.190|talk]]) 02:44, 9 November 2009 (UTC) == Removal of suspension damage? == :''Among the changes were the omission of the ability to "race modify" or add down force to production cars, removal of '''suspension damage''' and also re-absent of torque limits to races.'' What is that reference to ''suspension damage'' talking about? Citation?--''[[User:SportWagon|SportWagon]] ([[User talk:SportWagon|talk]]) 22:14, 25 September 2009 (UTC)'' :History shows the reference has been there since the first "real" (non-redirect) revision.--''[[User:SportWagon|SportWagon]] ([[User talk:SportWagon|talk]]) 22:17, 25 September 2009 (UTC)'' == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just modified 3 external links on [[Gran Turismo 3: A-Spec]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=771891712 my edit]. If you have any questions, or need the bot to ignore the links, or the page altogether, please visit [[User:Cyberpower678/FaQs#InternetArchiveBot|this simple FaQ]] for additional information. I made the following changes: *Corrected formatting/usage for http://www.gameinformer.com/Games/Review/200108/R03.0811.1014.44023.htm *Added archive https://web.archive.org/web/20070206025009/http://www.polyphony.co.jp/english/list.html to http://www.polyphony.co.jp/english/list.html *Added archive https://web.archive.org/web/20080916065905/http://asia.playstation.com/eng_hk/index.php?q=node%2F1517 to http://asia.playstation.com/eng_hk/index.php?q=node%2F1517 When you have finished reviewing my changes, you may follow the instructions on the template below to fix any issues with the URLs. {{sourcecheck|checked=false|needhelp=}} Cheers.—[[User:InternetArchiveBot|'''InternetArchiveBot''']] ([[User talk:InternetArchiveBot|Report bug]]) 02:44, 24 March 2017 (UTC) == Source == *https://web.archive.org/web/20020102041048/http://www.meristation.com/sc/noticias/noticia.asp?c=GEN&n=280
